Sentencas: The mismatch of thermal expansion coefficients (TECs) between cobalt-containing perovskite air electrodes and electrolytes is a great challenge for the development of thermo-mechanically durable solid oxide cells (SOCs).
Titulo: Minimized thermal expansion mismatch of cobalt-based perovskite air electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: In this work, we propose a facile design principle to directly grow highly dispersed Co reactive sites onto ion-conducting scaffolds and confine the dimension of active centres within nanoscale.
Titulo: Minimized thermal expansion mismatch of cobalt-based perovskite air electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: As a representative, the Co-socketed BaCe0.7Zr0.2Y0.1O3-delta perovskite (denoted as R-BCZY-Co) was constructed via a consecutive sol-gel and in situ exsolution approach.
Titulo: Minimized thermal expansion mismatch of cobalt-based perovskite air electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Combined XRD, H-2-TPR, SEM and TEM results confirm the emergence of Co nanoparticles on a BCZY matrix without the segregation of a secondary Co-rich phase.
Titulo: Minimized thermal expansion mismatch of cobalt-based perovskite air electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The symmetric half-cell measurement suggests that R-BCZY-Co air electrode with the optimal Co content of 10 mol% exhibits a 7-fold promoted oxygen activation performance with a polarization resistance of similar to 0.17 omega cm(2) at 750 degrees C.
Titulo: Minimized thermal expansion mismatch of cobalt-based perovskite air electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The TEC mismatch between fabricated R-BCZY-Co electrodes and BCZY electrolytes is minimized down to only similar to 11.4%, which is significantly lower than that of other representative counterparts.
Titulo: Minimized thermal expansion mismatch of cobalt-based perovskite air electrodes for solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Moreover, the detailed XPS result proves that the architecture of exsolved Co on BCZY possesses a higher concentration of surface oxygen vacancy, which further benefits the kinetics of ion diffusion and oxygen absorption.
Titulo: Minimized thermal expansion mismatch of cobalt-based perovskite air electrodes for solid oxide cells
